title: Towards Implicit Parallel Programming for Systems (Ph.D. defense talk)
description: This is the talk for my Ph.D. defense and basically describes the core foundations of Ohua.

title: Becoming Friends - Ohua in Database Management Systems
description: I gave this talk at Snowlfake in Berlin. It is the first talk where I draw bring Ohua in its current incarnation back to database management systems. Along these lines I gave my student [Justus Adam](https://justus.science) the topic for his Masters Thesis.

title: Scalable Operating System Design
description: I gave this during the interview process for a Senior Research position at Huawei. Since I was not an OS person, my task was to review a monolith and micro-kernel-based OS. I chose Singularity, of course!

title: Tech Problem: Ohua, Microservices and Microkernel-based Operating Systems
description: This talk that (for the first time) establishes the connection between Ohua-based microservices and services in a micro-kernel-based OS.

title: Ÿauhau - Compiling (Microservices) for Concise Code and Efficient I/O
description: The talk introduces the work from the Ÿauhau paper that is based on Ohua's programming model.

title: Ohua in Big Data Systems
venue: [9th International Workshop on Programming Models and Applications forMulticores and Manycores](https://ppopp18.sigplan.org/track/pmam-2018)
description: This talk gives a brief introduction on our approach to speed up sequential bottlenecks in big data systems (Hadoop Map/Reduce, Spark, Flink) using Ohua. This is where I introduced the idea behind `smap` for the first time.

title: Ohua - Stateful Functions
venue: [12th International Conference on Principles and Practices of Programming on the Java Platform: virtual machines, languages, and tools](http://pppj2015.cs.fit.edu/)
description: This is the talk where I presented the idea of a stateful function for the first time.

title: Non-blocking Live Updates for Dataflow Systems
description: This talk presents the basic ideas of the algorithm for non-blocking live updates. For a more detailed view, please have a look at the according paper.

title: Fast Travellers
description: This was my first academic talk tried to sum up the problem and approach from my Master's Thesis in 5 minute. (I think that did not work though ;) )
